Data: 12.30pm Australia won the toss and chose to bat
Abbott to Warner, FOUR runs what a start that is. Short and wide, the worst possible delivery to this guy. Warner laces the cut through point, with timing I didn't see too much in round 1
Abbott to Warner, no run another full outswinger, 147ks, encouraging carry to Wade, a far cry from the low bounce at the Providence. Ignored by the batsman again
Abbott to Warner, no run yorker, nudging 140ks, homing in on the off stump, squeezed out
Abbott to Warner, no run nicely bowled again. Just outside off - fifth-stump line and Warner defends again
Abbott to Warner, no run shapes this one away and starts it off on middle so that it goes to off. Warner blocks. Nice comeback

Abbott to Warner, FOUR runs poor delivery. So two bad deliveries gives Australia the start they wanted. Short and wide and Warner climbs all over it, thrashes a cut past point again, to the other side, more towards backward point
Rabada to Finch, no run full and wide outside off, Finch comes forward and leaves. Just a bit of away movement
Rabada to Finch, (no ball) overstepped. Can't do that KG. Back of a length outside off and Finch defends into the off side
Rabada to Finch, FOUR runs smears it to the midwicket boundary. Not a bad delivery actually, fullish on leg. Finch backs away and mis-times his lofted drive, all along the ground, through midwicket
Rabada to Finch, no run nice. Back of a length, swerves back in from outside off. Left alone
Rabada to Finch, 1 run nicely bowled. Attacking Finch's pads, but he is good enough to push to mid-on for a quick single. Good run
Rabada to Warner, no run back of a length on off,Warner blocks into the off side. Good, nagging lines

Rabada to Warner, no run superb stop. A boundary-saving dive from Parnell. Saved four in fact. Awesome. Short and wide from Rabada, and Warner cuts towards cover point where Parnell dives to his left and stops it
Abbott to Finch, no run a good length outside off, left alone. Finch showing some patience, could be a plan
Abbott to Finch, no run fullish on a fifth-stump line. Finch defends nicely
Abbott to Finch, no run hmm, shortish and wide outside off. Finch cuts but times it so badly that it doesn't leave the pitch.
Abbott to Finch, no run back of a length outside off, pushed to cover from the crease. Abbott's lines are good so far to Finch
Abbott to Finch, no run nice again. A good length outside off, and Finch leaves. Not bowling it too full
Abbott to Finch, no run keeps it outside off, Finch lunges forward to punch into the off side. So tight that over was, maiden.

Rabada to Warner, FOUR runs ooh, a bit of a sloppy misfield and four. Shortish and wide, didn't get the impression that he timed that too well. the cut went more towards cover where a bobble just in front of the fielder helps it take it past him
Rabada to Warner, no run back of a length on middle, dead-bat defense
Rabada to Warner, no run shortish and wide again, but not as wide. Warner chops a cut to cover point, dot ball
Rabada to Warner, no run full, maybe for the first time at that length. Warner stays back and pushes to mid-off. Not much movement for the SA bowlers

Rabada to Warner, SIX runs wow, gone all the way. Shortish on off, Warner pulls. So effortless, so lazy. Made sure he got his pull over square leg and even though he had to drag it from off, it goes well over.
Rabada to Warner, 1 run good single. Fullish on off, tip and run to cover. Great
Abbott to Warner, no run nagging away at that off bail. Warner stays in his crease to tap to point.
Abbott to Warner, no run slightly straight-ish and Warner works the ball off his hips towards square leg
Abbott to Warner, no run good stuff. Good length on middle, pushed to mid-on. Warner isn't moving his feet too much
Abbott to Warner, 1 run this time he takes it off his pads and works to fine leg
Abbott to Finch, 1 run another sloppy misfield from Phangiso at cover. Punched to him from the back foot and he parries it towards mid-off. These two make the run easily
Abbott to Warner, no run keeps it on a good length on off, not much even Warner can do about that. Defends to point. Splendid over
Rabada to Finch, no run fullish outside off, Finch presses forward and defends
Rabada to Finch, no run back of a length on middle, jags back enough to take the ball past Finch's inside edge. Smashes into his thigh pad
Rabada to Finch, no run looking for that yorker. 149.5 kph. A full toss, Finch inside-edges into his pad. Rabada appeals vociferously but clearly a lot of bat
Rabada to Finch, 1 run full and wide outside off, steered to third man for a run. Good from Finch, taking himself off strike
Rabada to Warner, no run speared in the blockhole again. 150.2 kph. Yikes, that's quick. Warner jams it out.

Rabada to Warner, 1 run may have been out with a direct hit. Warner pushes a good length delivery towards short cover and calls for one. Rabada runs to the ball as the crow flies. As a result, Finch has to deviate off course slightly. rabada misses the stumps though at the batsman's end
Abbott to Warner, FOUR runs nowhere near the middle but four more. Shortish on Warner's pads and Warner is through his swivel-pull too early. Goes to midwicket instead of behind square. Four
Abbott to Warner, no run fullish on off, defended
Abbott to Warner, no run a bit too straight and clipped to square leg. Hurried for pace again
Abbott to Warner, no run tapped to point. Good length again, good bowling
Abbott to Warner, no run back of a length on middle and leg. Defended again, great bowling. Keeping Warner quiet
Abbott to Warner, 1 run too straight and easily nudged to fine leg for a run. Slightly erring in line, but intentionally not offering width
Rabada to Warner, FOUR runs short and wide, smashed. Through point, four more. Not the right line. Warner stands tall and cuts it with ease
Rabada to Warner, no run keeps it tight on off. Nice line. Warner is forced to defend after looking to clip through the leg side
Rabada to Warner, 1 run shortish and wide, dabbed to third man after getting on top of the bounce. Good batting. Got it over the infield
Rabada to Finch, no run full on off, Finch pushes to mid-off from the crease
Rabada to Finch, (no ball) Rabada oversteps again. Not very good from him. Overly full outside off, Finch punches into the off side, where there is another parry to mid-off from cover
Rabada to Finch, FOUR runs shortish on off, Finch clears one foot, looks to smear over midwicket but is hurried for pace. As a result, the ball takes the top edge and flies over the keeper for four
Rabada to Finch, 1 run Finch opens the bat-face to guide to third man. Really clever batting
Abbott to Finch, no run overpitched outside off, drilled to mid-off
Abbott to Finch, no run fullish and wide outside off, good stuff. Finch leaves
Abbott to Finch, no run tight on off, full length. Pushed to cover
Abbott to Finch, no run good length on off, Finch turns the ball to midwicket
Abbott to Finch, no run 132 kph, but very close to off on a good length. Finch defends
Abbott to Finch, no run maiden. Good bowling from Abbott. Back of a length outside off, punched to cover
Tahir to Warner, 1 run shortish on off, Warner goes back and cuts powerfully to deep point
Tahir to Finch, 1 run tossed up on middle, Finch prods forward and inside-edges to midwicket
Tahir to Warner, no run the googly. Turns away from Warner, right into his cut. Straight to point
Tahir to Warner, no run shortish again outside off, steered to third man
Tahir to Warner, 1 run flat, very quick. 96 kph, punched to deep cover

Tahir to Finch, OUT gone. Finch persists with the sweep. Flat on off, the quicker delivery. Finch clears a front foot and tries to smash his sweep through square leg but was quite far from the ball. The ball missed his cross-batted swat and clattered into off stump. Tahir sets off in typical fashion. Finch struggled for any fluency in that knock.
Parnell to Warner, 1 run good length and straight, turned to square leg
Parnell to Khawaja, 1 run too straight to Khawaja who flicks one off his hips to fine leg
Parnell to Warner, no run pushed to mid-on from the crease
Parnell to Warner, no run full on off, pushed to Parnell from the crease. Good length, looking for some swing but there is none there
Parnell to Warner, no run shortish and wide, a poor ball. Warner finds point with his cut
Parnell to Warner, 1 run too short again, Warner finds the gap through point this time for a run to the sweeper cover
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs smashed for six. Easy does it. Tossed up on off, Warner clears his front foot and then smashes the ball straight past the bowler. Whacks the sightscreen. Shot.
Tahir to Warner, no run flatter on off, pulls his length back there. Defended nicely
Tahir to Warner, 1 run the googly outside off and Warner cuts to deep point. Great batting
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run some flight on off, much more confident against Khawaja than Warner is Tahir. Punched in the air to long-off
Tahir to Warner, no run full toss on middle, skewed to midwicket
Tahir to Warner, 1 run more flight outside off, thrashed down to long-off for a run.
Parnell to Warner, 1 run tucked off his hips to square leg
Parnell to Khawaja, no run shortish outside off, chopped into the surface, towards point

Parnell to Khawaja, 1 run close with a direct hit. Clipped from a full length to mid-on and Khawaja labours through to the other end. His bat jammed into Parnell's foot and lobbed up but he made it easily
Parnell to Warner, no run slower ball on leg, pushed to mid-on
Parnell to Warner, no run nice line. Nags away on off, chopped to cover.
Parnell to Warner, 1 run a good over. Just three singles off it. Back of a length on middle, Warner stays in his crease and turns the ball to square leg to get one
Duminy to Warner, 1 run flat on middle and leg to start, Warner punches to long-on from the back foot. Using the depth of the crease well
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run ooh, a bit of spin. Slow and short, and wide, slapped to deep cover
Duminy to Warner, 1 run drifts down leg, turned to midwicket for an easy single
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run another easy push to midwicket for a single. Good flight from Duminy
Duminy to Warner, no run slower and straighter, tighter. Warner defends from the crease
Duminy to Warner, 2 runs short and wide, smashed past cover for a couple. Good dive from the fielder at long-off to stop the boundary
Parnell to Khawaja, no run shortish outside off, chopped to the keeper. Khawaja trying to open the face to guide to third man but didn't get that
Parnell to Khawaja, 2 runs clipped off past square leg for a couple this time. Again, too straight from Parnell in the aim of attacking the stumps
Parnell to Khawaja, no run short and wide, Khawaja should have done more with that. Tried to cut but the ball went through
Parnell to Khawaja, 1 run dabbed to third man off the open face
Parnell to Warner, 1 run fifty for Warner. What form he is in. Slaps a short delivery to deep cover. Continues to churn out the runs. Quality innings, but a lot to be done
Parnell to Khawaja, no run fullish on off, pushed back to the bowler
Duminy to Warner, no run flight on off, Warner pushes towards point
Duminy to Warner, no run tossed up on off, punched to cover
Duminy to Warner, FOUR runs four. Easy. Too short from JP. Warner goes back and pulls in the gap behind square. Too easy. Poor ball
Duminy to Warner, no run tossed up on middle and leg, squirted to midwicket
Duminy to Warner, no run blocked from the front foot
Duminy to Warner, 1 run short and wide, scythed to deep point for one
Parnell to Warner, no run yorker, swerving in wickedly on leg, Warner jabs his bat down on it
Parnell to Warner, no run shorter and outside off, stops on Warner. He leaps and flat-bat swats it to point
Parnell to Warner, 2 runs short incoming ball on off, Warner hops and turns it neatly through square leg. Warner scampers back for the second. Sharp running
Parnell to Warner, 1 run short, angled in, tucked off the hips to long leg
Parnell to Khawaja, no run Khawaja presses forward and across as he dabs this cutter towards midwicket
Parnell to Khawaja, no run Warner pulls pace off it, another cutter, sticks in the surface and kicks up at Khawaja. He fends it with soft hands
Phangiso to Warner, FOUR runs and Warner welcomes the spinner with a reverse-swept four. Full enough outside off, Warner stretches forward and middles it through vacant slip for four
Phangiso to Warner, 2 runs Phangiso pulls his length back on middle, chopped from the stumps to sweeper cover off the back foot
Phangiso to Warner, no run tossed up, hint of turn around off, Warner smothers it
Phangiso to Warner, FOUR runs fired short and outside off, Warner skips back and cracks a cut through the covers, Rabada slides in vain at the edge of the boundary
Phangiso to Warner, no run much better from Phagiso. Lobs this on middle. Keeps Warner to a defence
Phangiso to Warner, 1 run slides on with the arm on middle, cut through backward point
Tahir to Warner, 1 run full and straight on middle from over the wicket, clipped to long-on
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run Tahir gives this more air outside off, Khawaja pushes it gently to long-off
Tahir to Warner, 1 run pushed through at the legs, tapped to long-on
Tahir to Khawaja, no run floats a wrong'un, full in length, poked towards point off an edge
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run Tahir now drops it short and outside off, Khawaja short-arm jabs it past midwicket
Tahir to Warner, no run full legbreak around off, pushed to the cover region
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run darted short and outside off, cut through point on the back foot
Phangiso to Warner, no run yikes! Pushed through outside off, shoots low, beating Warner's cut
Phangiso to Warner, 1 run Warner comes down the track to meet a full one early, whipped down to long-on
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run shorter and drifts in as Khawaja skips back and clips behind square
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run turn and bounce! It nibbles in and sticks in the surface. Blocked to the leg side
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run slid through on off, Khawaja goes back for a cut but is cramped for room. He ends up chopping it onto the pitch
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs Tahir finds turn and slips one down leg, Warner goes low and helps it away to the fine leg boundary with a nifty sweep
Tahir to Warner, 1 run legbreak on middle, Warner hangs back and milks a single through the square leg region
Tahir to Khawaja, 2 runs slides on outside off, Khawaja takes it from there and sweeps firmly through square leg, KG runs to his left from deep midwicket, slides, and keeps it to a couple
Tahir to Khawaja, no run Tahir pitches this outside off and gets it to turn in, defended off the back foot
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run another legbreak, on a length, swept through backward square leg
Tahir to Warner, no run ripping turn from round the wicket! Zips in from outside off, Warner does not cover for the spin. Prods and gets an inside edge onto the pad
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run Khawaja keeps sweeping from outside off, there are two men behind square. Short fine leg tidies this up
Phangiso to Warner, no run slides on just outside off, punched off the back foot to the covers
Phangiso to Warner, 1 run Warner skips out and meets a full ball, which is slapped to long-on. Warner keeps ticking. Australia keep ticking
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run spins in on middle, Khawaja plays back and nudges it towards backward square leg
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run full and turns on middle, down the track, and quietly pushed back to the bowler
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run shorter and outside off, stylishly whipped to deep midwicket
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run short and turns away outside off, cut away to short extra cover, where the fielder (Amla) dives to his right and fumbles
Duminy to Warner, no run skiddy full ball on middle, chopped to the off side
Duminy to Warner, 1 wide drifting down leg, sweep and a miss, wide
Duminy to Warner, no run length ball on off, solidly pushed to cover
Duminy to Warner, no run Warner uses his feet, JP held this one back on middle, defended
Duminy to Warner, FOUR runs JP drops it short on middle and leg, keeps low. But Warner went low with it and pulled it away past midwicket, beats long-on to his left
Duminy to Warner, no run nipping down leg, Warner deflects it towards square leg
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run tossed slow and outside off, sweep and a miss. Replays show that Phangiso hit the front pad outside off
Phangiso to Khawaja, SIX runs bang! Khawaja charges down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball outside off and launches it over long-off for the third six of the game
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run shorter and outside off, glanced towards short fine leg
Phangiso to Warner, no run spins in on off, full in length, Warner is forward to smother it
Phangiso to Warner, 1 run too full on off now, neatly flicked to long-on
Phangiso to Khawaja, no run goes on straight outside off, Khawaja is on the back foot as he whips to midwicket
Duminy to Warner, 1 run short and drifts in on middle, punched down to long-on
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run short offbreak outside off, jabbed down to long-on
Duminy to Warner, no run full and straight on off, hits the pad first. Muffled lbw shout. Not given. Interesting... Impact in line. The tracker shows that it would have hit the top of the leg stump.
Duminy to Warner, 1 run whirls down a quicker ball on middle, pushed to long-on
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run full toss on middle, whipped past midwicket
Duminy to Warner, no run full and turns away slightly outside off, Warner pushes and misses
Rabada to Khawaja, 1 run back of a length and outside off, run down to third man
Rabada to Warner, no run Warner hops and guides this short ball to point
Rabada to Warner, no run short and outside off, Warner crunches a cut.. JP dives to his right at backward point and makes a smart stop
Rabada to Warner, 1 run tucked off the hips behind square on the leg side
Rabada to Khawaja, FOUR runs veering down the leg side, Khawaja just helps it on its way for four
Rabada to Khawaja, no run banged in short on middle, the batsman hops and defends it back to the bowler
Duminy to Warner, no run loopier on middle, blocked on the front foot
Duminy to Warner, 1 run angled in from round the stumps, tapped to long-off
Duminy to Khawaja, no run short on middle, backs away and cuts to backward point
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run dropped short and that's cut away again. Cover-point (Rabada) dives to his left and makes a half stop
Duminy to Warner, 2 runs excellent running. Warner just picked it off the pads behind square and set off
Duminy to Warner, no run full and straight, pushed to off side on the front foot
Rabada to Khawaja, 1 run full and at the pads, twirled down to fine leg

Rabada to Warner, 2 runs short and width outside off, Warner cracks it. Cuts through point. Phangiso runs to his right from sweeper and hunts it down with a well-timed slide. Warner's timing was better, though
Rabada to Warner, 1 run short and angled away outside off, steered to third man
Rabada to Khawaja, 1 run another full leg-stump ball, this is clipped through midwicket
Rabada to Warner, no run off-stump yorker, squeezed out
Rabada to Warner, 2 runs tucked off the pads behind square. He charges back for the second
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 run straighter one, nudged wide of midwicket
Duminy to Warner, 1 run full on middle and leg, bunted to short midwicket
Duminy to Khawaja, no run full and dips on middle, leaves the batsman searching for a flick. He skews it back to the bowler off a leading edge. Rolls down the pitch
Duminy to Khawaja, no run width outside off, biffed to Amla at short extra cover
Duminy to Khawaja, 2 runs picked away off the pads past short fine leg for two
Duminy to Khawaja, 1 wide fired fast and down leg, sweep and a miss, wide called by ump Wilson
Duminy to Khawaja, no run drifts in slow on middle, blocked on the front foot
Abbott to Warner, (no ball) 1 run full and angling away outside off from over the wicket, pushed through the covers
Abbott to Khawaja, 1 run full and outside off, hacked to long-on. Misses out on the free-hit
Abbott to Warner, no run full on middle, defended
Abbott to Warner, 1 run too full on middle, pushed to the left of short extra cover to long-off
Abbott to Khawaja, no run good length and skating across the left-hander, beaten
Abbott to Khawaja, no run full on off, shuffles across and clips to short midwicket
Abbott to Khawaja, no run back of a length and angled away outside off, punched to short extra cover
Duminy to Warner, 1 run Warner steps out, takes it on the full and drives to long-off
Duminy to Khawaja, no run full and shoots low, turns and foils the timing. Skewered to midwicket
Duminy to Khawaja, FOUR runs pushed down leg, Khawaja sweeps and tickles it fine on the leg side
Duminy to Khawaja, FOUR runs flighted half-volley outside off, Khawaja unfurls a languid cover drive, nobody sweeping the boundary there
Duminy to Khawaja, no run quicker and spins away outside off, chopped to extra cover
Duminy to Khawaja, no run looped on the leg stump, defended
Abbott to Warner, no run full and attacking the stumps, played back to the bowler
Abbott to Warner, 1 run short on the hips, short-arm jab to deep midwicket. Warner moves to 99
Abbott to Khawaja, 1 run dug in outside off, Khawaja steps across off and whips to short midwicket, where Amla did not bend enough, letting it slip through his legs

Abbott to Warner, 1 run played, Warner. Subdued celebrations. No leap to the moon, there. He kisses the helmet and raises his bat. Short and wide outside off, Warner cuts to sweeper cover and raises his century
Abbott to Khawaja, 2 runs cutter drifting down leg, helped to fine leg for two
Abbott to Khawaja, 1 run short and just a shade outside off, time for Khawaja to raise his bat. Punched to mid-off for a half-century. He is embraced by Warner
Parnell to Khawaja, 1 run full and straight, whipped smartly to long leg
Parnell to Warner, no run short and angled in, defended
Parnell to Warner, no run back of a length and outside off, chopped to extra cover
Parnell to Warner, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, stops on Warner. He does not bother, swatting it over midwicket
Parnell to Warner, no run short and angled in on off, tucks him up for room. Blocked
Parnell to Warner, 1 run short and wide outside off, flat-batted away. FB dives and makes a half save at short extra cover
Abbott to Warner, no run tucked from leg stump to midwicket
Abbott to Warner, (no ball) 2 runs dug in on the leg stump, pings the top of the front pad as Warner misses the flick. The fast bowler has overstepped by a substantial margin
Abbott to Warner, 2 runs Warner moves away outside leg, the bowler chases him with a full ball, which is skewed in the air... past extra cover
Abbott to Warner, no run and Warner backs away again and is followed, this time by a short ball, dabbed to the off side
Abbott to Warner, 1 leg bye short and heading down leg, off the thigh to short fine leg
Abbott to Khawaja, FOUR runs poor ball, put away. Back of a length and down leg, swivel-pulled to fine leg
Abbott to Khawaja, no run short and ducks in, poked back to Abbott

Parnell to Warner, OUT gone! What a start this is for SA after the drinks break. A short delivery on middle is pulled powerfully but straight to midwicket. Comfortable height too. Warner was waiting on that back foot and hit it beautifully, just some indecisiveness whether to go over or keep it down. In the end, did neither. But what an innings that was
Parnell to Smith, no run fullish length on off, Smith doesn't shuffle too much and plays a block to cover
Parnell to Smith, 1 run poor delivery. Short on leg, Smith rocks back to pull to deep square leg. Nicely played
Parnell to Khawaja, no run overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
Parnell to Khawaja, no run superbly bowled. Yorker on off, almost gets through. Khawaja jams it out to point. Good over so far
Parnell to Khawaja, no run superb save from Behardien. Parnell applauds, rightly so. Overpitched and driven exquisitely to cover's right, he puts in a lovely dive to stop runs
Phangiso to Smith, no run tossed up on off, pushed to point with the turn.
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run a rank long-hop and Smith pummels a pull to midwicket. Shot
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run dances down the track to drill to long-on for a run. Good use of the feet
Phangiso to Smith, no run fantastic from AB this time. Tossed up on off, driven towards long-off but AB saves the run with a dive from cover
Phangiso to Smith, no run punched to cover off the back foot
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run a touch too short outside off, Smith hurries back to punch to deep cover this time. Another tidy over.
Tahir to Smith, 1 run a naughty full toss on middle and clipped to deep square leg. Smith should have put that away

Tahir to Khawaja, no run AB drops a clanger. Yes, AB. It's de Villiers. AB. A tossed up googly outside off, Khawaja gets a top-edge which carries to square leg. AB gets around from midwicket, sets up under it, waits for the ball and then drops it. Maybe hit the hard part of his hand
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run punched to long-off
Tahir to Smith, no run
Tahir to Smith, no run Smith tries to sweep a full, straight delivery but misses it almost, just gets a thin edge which saved him
Tahir to Smith, 1 run Smith runs to the ball and drills a drive to long-on. Another good over. SA racking em up
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run slowish outside off, Smith opens the bat face very late to guide to short third man. Well played
Phangiso to Khawaja, 1 run flat outside off, Khawaja turns the ball towards backward square leg for a run
Phangiso to Smith, no run another dot. Short and wide, Smith cuts but straight to point
Phangiso to Smith, no run more flight and loop on off, Smith defends towards cover. Wants one but doesn't get it
Phangiso to Smith, no run steered to point
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run leg side-ish on the pads and worked to long-on
Tahir to Smith, 1 run googly on off, wristily flicked to long-on
Tahir to Khawaja, no run flight outside off, slow. Khawaja lunges forward and leaves!
Tahir to Khawaja, 1 run very flat on middle and leg, nurdled to deep square leg
Tahir to Smith, no run flat on off, Smith tries to clip to square leg but can't
Tahir to Smith, no run beautiful bowling. Flight on off, Smith comes down and keeps it out
Tahir to Smith, no run another dot. Short and wide, mistimed to cover

Phangiso to Khawaja, OUT taken this time! Amla takes it, and Khawaja has to go. Flat on off, Khawaja gets low to sweep and gets another top edge which goes up in the air and is taken at short fine leg. Beautiful bowling, not afraid to give the ball some air even to the left-hander. Australia losing their way
Phangiso to Bailey, no run a bit of turn, well bowled. Flat outside off, extracts some purchase and pushed to point
Phangiso to Bailey, no run flat outside off. Bailey comes down but pads it back to the bowler
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run short and wide, scythed to deep point
Phangiso to Smith, no run more flight on middle and leg, defended
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run pushed to long-on
Tahir to Smith, 1 run flat on off, Smith flicks easily to backward square leg for one. Much quicker there
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run paddle-swept to deep fine leg. Aus' 200 is up
Tahir to Smith, 2 runs full toss on middle and leg, flicked past midwicket for a couple. Better footwork from SMith, getting close to the pitch
Tahir to Smith, no run slow and wide outside off, pushed to point
Tahir to Smith, 1 run thrashed to deep cover
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run another paddle sweep attempted. Off the toe-end towards short third man for one instead

Phangiso to Bailey, SIX runs shot! Bailey runs to the pitch of the ball, gets there and puts the ball over long-on with a beautiful lofted drive. Once he got to the pitch, it was always going to be a safe shot
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run clipped to backward square leg
Phangiso to Smith, FOUR runs outside edge and that will be four more. Short and wide, width. Smith under-edges to the third man boundary.
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run too much width again, laced to deep point for one
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run flat outside off, Bailey hurries back to nudge to square leg
Phangiso to Smith, no run full and straight, Smith defends
Rabada to Smith, FOUR runs smashed for four. Quite full, Smith sees the opportunity and swivel-flicks it to the square leg boundary. Played that nicely, on the bounce
Rabada to Smith, 1 run low full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
Rabada to Wade, 1 run looking for a mow over midwicket but Wade inside-edges onto his pads and back up the pitch. A scampered run
Rabada to Smith, 1 run short and wide, slapped to cover with terrible timing. Just the one, fantastic bowling. Taking pace off that short delivery
Rabada to Wade, 2 runs fullish on middle and leg, clipped towards wide long-on. A fumble allows the second. Aus bring up 250
Rabada to Wade, 1 wide good short one to end. But a wide called. Shortish outside off, Wade doesn't interfere. The ball is over head height
Rabada to Wade, 1 run smeared to long-on for just one this time
Abbott to Wade, no run full and wide outside off, Wade went across to ramp over short fine leg but gets an inside edge back to the keeper
Abbott to Wade, 1 run shortish on off, smeared to midwicket. Just the one.
Abbott to Smith, 1 run overpitched outside off, drilled to mid-off for just one. Australia going nowhere in these last few overs
Abbott to Wade, FOUR runs superb timing. Picked his spot and executed. Fullish outside off, Wade backs away and times a lofted cover drive. Easily over cover and four. good spot in the field
Abbott to Wade, 2 runs wow, what an effort from du Plessis at long-off. Absolutely smashed, du Plessis got there and stopped it.
Abbott to Wade, 1 run smeared to deep square leg for just the run. A splendid effort from Abbott, nine off the last but a very good spell nonetheless

Tahir to Bailey, OUT given! Bailey is gone. Wrong un' from Tahir on middle, strikes Bailey in front. Bailey reviews. That looks pretty adjacent. It has spun a little into Bailey and he did have a significant stride. his only hope is height I guess. No bat. Umpire's call, just clipping leg stump so Bailey has to go.
Tahir to Marsh, no run another googly to start outside off, kept out
Tahir to Marsh, no run flat on off, defended
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run shortish and wide, flat. Cut to deep point
Tahir to Smith, no run another googly outside off, very similar to the Bailey wicket. But slightly outside the line I guess
Tahir to Smith, no run flat outside off, patted to point. Superb bowling
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run driven, from outside off, to deep cover
Phangiso to Smith, FOUR runs lovely shot. Slightly short, not very. But Smith picks up the length quickly, picks the gap and then pulls to the midwicket boundary. Landed just inside
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run push and run to AB at cover, who is very quick on it and releases even quicker. De kock takes the bails off but Marsh is back
Phangiso to Marsh, no run slowish on middle and leg, kept out
Phangiso to Marsh, no run driven to cover again, another dot ball
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run sees Marsh coming so Phangiso shortens the length outside off, thrashed to deep cover
Rabada to Wade, FOUR runs lovely shot. Gets down low and ramps the ball past fine leg. Executed. Used the pace. Landed just inside again
Rabada to Wade, 2 runs full toss on middle, takes Wade by surprise who smears to square leg, losing his bat in the process. Almost went on to hit the stumps. Hmm. Two though
Rabada to Wade, FOUR runs goes again and he'll get four again. Slightly leg side-ish and Wade gets low and ramps the scoop over the keeper.
Rabada to Wade, 1 run smashed but straight to Behardien at mid-off. A direct hit would have had Wade
Rabada to Smith, 1 run superb yorker. On middle. Smith backs away and carves a ball to backward point. Right idea, just missed out on four

Rabada to Wade, OUT full and straight, given! Yorker on off, Wade sets up for another scoop and misses it. The ball strikes Wade well outside off though, Umpire Joel Wilson gives him out. Shocking decision, struck him well outside the line
Parnell to Smith, FOUR runs flat-batted to the long-off boundary. Back of a length on off, Smith probably premeditated a shot to that area, considering mid-off was up
Parnell to Smith, 1 run overpitched on off, jammed out to cover
Parnell to Faulkner, 1 run fullish on off, just pushed to point to get one. Faulkner wanted to give strike to Smith I presume
Parnell to Smith, 2 runs shortish on off, pulled in front of deep square leg for a couple. Decent shot but lacking any timing
Parnell to Smith, FOUR runs superb batting again. Gives himself room and lofts the ball over cover, and he gets four. Picking his spots really well. Fifty for Smith, a tad slow but has got the runs
Parnell to Smith, 2 runs smeared to deep midwicket for a couple. Parnell fumbles the throw from Behardien, could have prevented the extra run

4.50pm Australia huffed and puffed to 288, just 103 off the last 15 overs and losing five wickets in that period. After Warner's sixth ODI ton, his first outside Australia, it looked like a score of 310 was on but they lost wickets and played out too many dots, losing plenty of momentum in the process. May seem weird but SA will be happy with this score. Chase in a bit.
5.20pm Thanks, Nikhil. Hello again. Amla and Qdk are out in the middle. The returning Starc is armed with the new ball.
Starc to de Kock, no run swing right away from over the wicket. Angled in and swerves away outside off, left alone
Starc to de Kock, no run 147ks, left alone outside off again
Starc to de Kock, no run nudging 140ks. Full and defended
Starc to de Kock, FOUR runs half-volley outside off, no swing, Qdk lines it up and caresses a drive through the covers. Pleasing stroke, easy on the eye
Starc to de Kock, FOUR runs inswinger on the pads, too full again, picked away through square leg. Neatly done from the batsman
Starc to de Kock, no run back of a length on middle and leg now, defended
Hazlewood to Amla, 1 wide full and slants down leg, wide
Hazlewood to Amla, no run full and outside off, forward and driven to point
Hazlewood to Amla, no run full and angled in on off, Amla covers up in defence
Hazlewood to Amla, 1 run short and width outside off, Amla cuts and finds Khawaja at third man
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run full and angled away on off, Qdk nudges a single to square leg
Hazlewood to Amla, no run shortish on off, Amla keeps back and runs it down to fly slip
Hazlewood to Amla, no run full and comes in at off stump, Amla is firmly in line to block
Starc to de Kock, no run full and angled in on middle, forward and solidly pushed to mid-off
Starc to de Kock, no run full and skating in at 144.7ks, Qdk is a touch late as he pokes an outside edge to mid-off
Starc to de Kock, no run too full on off, clipped to mid-on
Starc to de Kock, 1 run hurled full, homing in on middle, flicked to mid-on for one
Starc to Amla, no run full and fired at off 149.3ks, Amla taps to mid-off
Starc to Amla, no run half volley outside off, Amla uses the pace of Starc and plays a wristy drive, which is stopped by Warner at backward point with a dive
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run full and outside off, Qdk glides it to backward point
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run Hazlewood bowls it on a back of a length outside off, chopped to the same fielder
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run short and angled in, rears up at Qdk, who loosens his grip and fends it back to the pitch
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run back of a length and angled on off, turned behind square on the leg side
Hazlewood to Amla, 1 run back of a length and around off, Amla plays late, dabbing a cut past fly slip to third man
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run back of a length and angled in, chopped to the left of Wade
Starc to de Kock, no run fuller and outside off, 144ks, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
Starc to de Kock, no run Starc keeps it full. This is an off-stump yorker, in fact. Kept out
Starc to de Kock, 1 wide banged in short and wide outside off, too wide. Qdk shaped to cut before bailing out at the last moment
Starc to de Kock, 1 run short on off, cramps the batsman for room. Chopped to point for one
Starc to Amla, FOUR runs full and angling away outside off, Amla slaps it away. Driven on the up over short extra-cover
Starc to Amla, no run good length and swerves in, Amla squirts it in front of his feet with an inside edge

Starc to Amla, 4 leg byes short and down leg, 138ks, Amla shapes to pull and tickles it off the thigh glove, beats Wade and runs away.... It bounced up chest-high at the keeper. Smith chases the ball, he was in contact with the ropes while touching the ball and looking to haul it in. Should have been runs
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run full, angled in, goes away, catches the outside edge and rolls to point
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run back of a length and angled in, Qdk drops it to backward point and gets off to the other end
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run inducker cramps the left-hander for room, defended onto the pitch
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run full and angled in on middle, blocked back to the bowler
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run reverts to the shorter length outside off, angled towards short third man
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run full and straight, clipped past the square leg umpire
Faulkner to de Kock, no run full and on middle, defended back
Faulkner to de Kock, 1 run too full on middle, punched down the ground. Mid-on dives and deflects the ball to mid-off

Faulkner to Amla, no run overpitched and outside off, Amla drills a drive to mid-off. The fielder effects a direct hit. Qdk had set off but undid his steps in time. Well in time. Finch was the fielder there
Faulkner to Amla, no run sliding into the pads, Amla plays across the line and misses the flick. The ball rolls off the pad towards point
Faulkner to Amla, no run Amla clears his front leg and stabs this off-stump ball to midwicket. Off the inside half of the bat
Faulkner to Amla, FOUR runs short and angling across Amla, gives him the width. And Amla happily cuts it away through point
Hazlewood to de Kock, FOUR runs belted across the line for four! Back of a length and angled in around off, Qdk shuffles across and swats it over backward square leg
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full and angled in on off, Faf loosens his grip and defends it back to the bowler
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run full and angled in on middle and leg, Faf dabs a single in front of mid-on
Hazlewood to Amla, FOUR runs short and Hazlewood gifts width outside off, Amla tears open the wrapper and slaps it behind point, beats third man to his right. He leans back and nails it!
Hazlewood to Amla, no run full and aimed at off, Amla respects it with a quiet defence
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run back of a length on middle, Faf stands tall and punches to mid-off
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run shorter on off, Faf presents a high elbow as he solidly punches to short extra cover
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run short on middle, angled to backward point
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run too full on off, driven on the front foot to mid-off
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run length and outside off, sliced past backward point towards third man
Faulkner to Amla, no run back of a length and tails into Amla, he yanks his bottom hand off the bat as he defends it
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run too full and straight, Faf welcomes Mitch Marsh with a whipped single to deep midwicket
Marsh to Amla, 1 run full toss, dips on the leg stump, picked away to deep midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs angled into the pads, Faf helps it away to the fine leg boundary
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run too full on middle, driven down the ground. Crisp.... Mid-on throws himself to his left to stop the ball
Marsh to Amla, 1 run full and straight, Amla camps back and guides it behind square
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run cutter outside off, Faf shows the full face of the bat and drives to short extra cover
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run full on off, slapped to point
Faulkner to du Plessis, FOUR runs Faf gallops down the track and slaps again. This is sent over the covers even as the ball was angling away from him
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run short and angling away, Faf plays late and runs it down to third man
Faulkner to Amla, no run full cutter, opens up Amla slightly. He plays across the line, searches for a flick, and rolls a leading edge onto the pitch
Faulkner to Amla, 1 run Faulkner goes wide of the crease and angles it into Amla, turned to leg
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run overpitched and outside off, eased to short extra cover
Marsh to Amla, FOUR runs top stroke from Amla. Bisects mid-on and mid-off. Full on off, not a half volley, driven ram-rod straight down the ground
Marsh to Amla, 1 run full on the pads, worked to midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, no run short on off, Faf gets on top of the bounce and plays to point
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs Faf skips out again, meets a length ball and bashes it over mid-on. Faf has been pretty busy this evening. No faffing around
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run veering into the pads, turned to long leg
Marsh to Amla, 1 run short on off, worked behind square with the wrists
Faulkner to Amla, no run full and angled in from round the wicket, straightens off the surface, and beats the edge
Faulkner to Amla, 1 run full and angled in on off, Amla shuffles back and dabs a single to the left of square leg
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run fraction full on off, Faf middles the drive and finds extra cover. Placement was missing, though
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run short on off from wide of the crease, swatted to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Amla, 1 run Amla slots this full ball to deep cover with a drive
Faulkner to du Plessis, 2 runs veering into the hips, glanced to deep square leg. Two. Busy running. SA building nicely in this 289 chase
Marsh to Amla, 1 run full and angled in on middle, Amla goes back and clips to deep midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run dug in short on middle, Faf gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists to control a pull to deep midwicket
Marsh to Amla, no run slightly overpitched and outside off, Amla drives uppishly to short extra cover
Marsh to Amla, 1 run veering into the pads, tucked around the corner
Marsh to du Plessis, no run dug in short on off, Faf does not get on top of the bounce this time. Flaps a pull to mid-on
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs full on off, steered to deep cover via an open face
Zampa to Amla, 1 run short and outside off, cut on the back foot to sweeper cover
Zampa to du Plessis, no run straighter one, pushed to the off side
Zampa to du Plessis, no run short again, googly? Faf pulls and gets an under edge onto the pad
Zampa to du Plessis, no run short legbreak outside off, slapped to short extra cover
Zampa to du Plessis, no run turn and bounce! Legbreak leaves Faf outside off and defeats the cut
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flighted and full on off, squeezed back to Zampa
Marsh to Amla, 1 run short on off, Amla plays late and steers it to third man
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Faf has a leaden-footed slash at it and sends a thick outside edge through the vacant cordon
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run cutter outside off, eased down to long-off
Marsh to Amla, 1 run back of a length and outside off, cut to deep cover
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs leg-stump ball, glanced past short fine leg
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run shortish on off, angled to short third man where the fielder fumbles
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run loopy legbreak outside off, driven to long-off
Zampa to Amla, no run legbreak again, the length is short and is cut away to backward point
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run googly, zips into the right-hander, played to the off side for one
Zampa to Amla, 2 runs fired short on middle, Amla drops back and pulls firmly over midwicket
Zampa to Amla, 1 run slider outside off, chopped out to sweeper cover
Finch to Amla, no run nice start, tossed up on off, drilled back at him
Finch to Amla, SIX runs quite an ugly shot by Amla's standards but what a shot that is. Too much flight, Amla clears his front foot and drills the lofted drive over long-off. Sliced it
Finch to Amla, no run short and wide outside off, mis-timed to midwicket
Finch to Amla, 1 run punched to the sweeper cover off the back foot
Finch to du Plessis, 1 run flight on off, too full. Faf lunges forward and drives to long-off
Finch to Amla, 1 run the flat, quick, slider/darter. Amla picks it and drives to long-on with ease
Zampa to Amla, no run more flight on off but the length is good, Amla taps to point. Just short enough to command respect
Zampa to Amla, 1 run overpitched outside off and muscled to deep cover
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run too full, straight. Driven to long-off, these two doing it easy
Zampa to Amla, FOUR runs nice. Splendid spot. Some flight on the legbreaj on off, Amla opens up his stance and hits over cover with a straight bat.
Zampa to Amla, 1 run flat on off, pushed to long-off
Zampa to du Plessis, no run slower and wider outside off, hit to cover. Not a bad over at all but still seven riskless runs
Finch to Amla, 1 run flight outside off and pushed to long-off
Finch to du Plessis, 1 run well bowled, slower on middle and turned to fine leg. good length
Finch to Amla, 1 run way too full and easily driven to long-off. An easy fifty for Amla, has made things look so classy
Finch to du Plessis, 1 run slowed up through the air and bunted to long-off with a languid drive
Finch to Amla, no run short, slow and wide, Chopped to cover
Finch to Amla, no run a shake of the head from Amla as he picks out cover off a half-volley outside off
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs shortish and wide, slapped past cover for a brace. Great batting this
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run short and wide, a loose offering and laced to deep point. SA eating away at this target
Zampa to Amla, FOUR runs pummeled for four. A full toss from Zampa on middle, smashed past the bowler. Races away for four to long-on
Zampa to Amla, no run adjusts his length by tossing it up on middle, a solid block ensues
Zampa to Amla, 1 run the slider on off, Amla rocks back and cuts to deep point
Zampa to du Plessis, no run beautiful drift, slides it towards leg and gets some purchase towards middle. Faf blocks
Starc to Amla, 1 run superb yorker outside off, Amla opens the face of his bat to guide to third man
Starc to du Plessis, no run overpitched on off and driven back to the bowler
Starc to du Plessis, no run excellent bowling. Looking for that yorker again, just misses as a low full toss is jammed out to cover
Starc to du Plessis, no run full on middle and blocked comfortably. these two intent on playing Starc out which is the right strategy
Starc to du Plessis, no run full and wide, inviting the drive. Faf obliges but finds cover

Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs oh yes. What a shot. So many of those shots in Zimbabwe against Australia are similar to this one. Full on middle, Faf presents the straight bat and lofts the ball right over the umpire. Four to long-off. Shot of the day?
Marsh to Amla, 1 run poor line. Drifts on leg and clipped to fine leg. Smith trying to get through his fifth bowler
Marsh to du Plessis, no run a good length outside off, Faf bunts to cover. through the shot slightly too early
Marsh to du Plessis, no run nice lines. Closer to off, played away towards cover
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run punched to the sweeper cover off the front foot
Marsh to Amla, no run full and straight, worked to midwicket. Better line to Amla
Marsh to Amla, 1 run 124 kph, slower ball outside off, may have stopped in the surface just a tad. Bunted to deep cover. Amla through the shot way too early
Starc to Amla, no run ooh, full and wide, some late away shape. Amla drives but doesn't connect. That wide slip would have been interested
Starc to Amla, 1 run yorker on leg, jammed out towards midwicket. Good run, both respond positively and the run is easy
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs nicely played. Reached out for the drive but drove it past cover for a brace.
Starc to du Plessis, no run another yorker on off, played back to Starc who feigns a throw
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run a high full toss outside off, outside-edged to third man and Faf has fifty on his return to cricket from a finger injury
Starc to Amla, no run well played. A full length delivery outside off is pushed to backward point. No reason to play an exuberant stroke
Marsh to du Plessis, no run full and straight, Faf pats to point, looking for one but Amla doesn't want it
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run driven to the sweeper cover from the crease
Marsh to Amla, 1 run slower ball on middle, played towards short midwicket for a quick single. 100 partnership for these two
Marsh to du Plessis, no run keeps it full and straight again, on middle. Steered to point
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run driven to long-off easily
Marsh to Amla, no run pushed to mid-off to end a tidy over from Marsh
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs smashed off the back foot to deep cover. Too much width from Hazlewood
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full and wide, intentionally bowled. Faf leaves
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run driven to long-off. Too full that time. Faf in great touch
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run oohs from the fielders. A good length delivery, darting back in and AB chops one to the keeper, just evades the stumps
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run clipped towards midwicket to get off the mark
Zampa to de Villiers, 1 run slower outside off, driven to deep cover
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flight and drift to leg, pushed to midwicket
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs short and wide from Zampa, scythed to deep point and Faf rushes back for the second easily
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run slower on off, short. Nice length. Driven to deep cover. Good control over his variations
Zampa to de Villiers, FOUR runs short on off, smashed to the square leg boundary. Got down early. His first boundary this series, after 91 balls.
Zampa to de Villiers, no run flight outside off, AB shuffles across to sweep but misses. Struck on the body
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run jags back in again towards off. Faf was looking to drive through the off side but chopped it to the keeper
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run and again. Just coming back enough to ensure Faf cannot drive through the off side. Jammed back towards the stumps
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full and wide outside off, slapped to point
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run shortish length outside off, punched to long-off
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 2 runs smeared to midwicket. Again, de Villiers was looking to go straight but the inward movement took it off towards square leg

Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs oh yes. Suddenly, a flurry of boundaries for AB. The place he wanted to go off the previous delivery. Full on middle, a splendid on-drive hurtles to the long-on boundary
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flight on off, pushed to cover
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run shortish and wide, smashed to deep cover. Varying his pace quite well here Zampa
Zampa to de Villiers, 1 run more flight on middle, Ab drives, with the spin, to long-off. Played that well. Good battle
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run pushed in the same gap, to long-off
Zampa to de Villiers, 1 run slightly short and AB rocks back to cut to deep point
Zampa to du Plessis, no run nice end. Slow on leg, Faf clears his leg slightly and defends. Doesn't want the slider to hit the pad

Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs advances and smeared to the midwicket boundary. One of AB's most un-pleasing boundaries. Runs to the pitch, looking to go straight, but the inswing helps skew the stroke off the inside half
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run full and straight, played to midwicket
Hazlewood to de Villiers, SIX runs my word. What ease. Short and wide outside off, AB stands tall and swats the ball over midwicket. Never in any fear or hesitation. Smashed for six.
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run overpitched on off, driven to long-on
Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs edged for four this time. Fullish line outside off, AB plays the line but the ball moves away ever so slightly and takes the outside edge. No slip in place
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run a mis-timed drive to mid-off
Faulkner to du Plessis, no run patted to point. Some miscommunication as AB comes halfway down before he is sent back. All's well that ends well
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run uppish but safe. Pace off the ball again, 120 kph. Faf finds a gap at cover to get one
Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run glided off the open face to point for one
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run Faulkner from over the wicket, bowls a full and straight delivery. Driven to long-off
Faulkner to de Villiers, no run another slower delivery on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Faulkner to de Villiers, no run 128 kph slower ball to finish and worked to midwicket
Starc to Duminy, no run fullish, tailing back in late from outside off. Duminy inside-edges into his body
Starc to Duminy, no run a full toss outside off, kept out
Starc to Duminy, 1 run ooh, full again, swerving back in. Duminy drives but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg for one
Starc to de Villiers, no run yorker outside off, jammed out again
Starc to de Villiers, no run quite full on middle, driven to mid-on
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run fullish and wide, slapped to deep cover
Faulkner to de Villiers, no run tight lines around off, blocked back with a punchy drive
Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run worked away to deep square leg
Faulkner to Duminy, FOUR runs just got enough to clear mid-off. Full and wide, JP went after it and got just enough on his drive to clear the fielder. Good intent though
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run guided to third man for one
Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run too full on middle and leg, and pushed to long-on
Starc to de Villiers, 1 run full and angled in from wide of the crease, AB square drives and ends up slicing it to deep point. Smith at slip could come into play
Starc to Duminy, 1 run full and ducks back in, Duminy squirts it to fine leg off an inside edge
Starc to de Villiers, 1 run full inswinger, bunted down to mid-on. Hazlewood is hanging back there. AB is quick anyway
Starc to Duminy, no run full and straight, 146ks, jabbed back to the bowler
Starc to Duminy, no run full and snakes in outside off, Duminy aims to drive it rather square. He has to settle with another inside edge. Starc is working to shoot through that gate
Starc to Duminy, no run back of a length and swings in, blocked to the leg side
Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run picked away off the pads to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Duminy, no run shortish and on off, punched back at the bowler
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run dug in short and outside off, Duminy drags it from there and miscues it in the air. Does to carry to a diving Finch at mid-on. Just drops short. Duminy is shaky
Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run fraction short and outside off, bottom-handed shovel to long-on
Faulkner to Duminy, no run another inside edge. Duminy has a hard heave at this incoming ball and squirts an inside edge onto the front pad
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run too full on middle, bunted to long-off
Starc to Duminy, FOUR runs low full toss outside off, gives Duminy the release. He eases forward and drives it through point for four
Starc to Duminy, FOUR runs that should give Duminy more confidence. Pretty full on middle, Duminy lifts it with authority over mid-on. Nice high-elbow pose for the cameras
Starc to Duminy, no run hurled in full on middle, defended back
Starc to Duminy, 1 run inswinging full toss on middle, pushed calmly to long-on
Starc to de Villiers, 1 run full ball, angled in from wide of the crease and bends away. Messes up with AB's drive and induces an outside edge that rolls behind point to third man
Starc to Duminy, 2 runs overpitched and outside off, Duminy leans forward. Good weight transfer easing a drive to short extra cover, who dives, takes some pace off the ball
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run short and wide outside off, AB laces a cut to deep point
Marsh to Duminy, no run full and angled in, turned to short midwicket
Marsh to Duminy, no run short and width outside off, late cut to backward point, straight to the fielder
Marsh to Duminy, no run cutter straightens just outside off, dab and miss. JP played early and didn't touch it
Marsh to Duminy, no run good length and angled in on the off stump, whipped to short midwicket
Marsh to Duminy, no run back of a length, outside off, chopped to short third man
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run full and straight, clipped through backward square leg for one
Hazlewood to Duminy, 1 run Duminy steps down the track, the bowler shortens his length outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run pitched up on off, milked down to long-on
Hazlewood to Duminy, 1 leg bye full on leg stump, JP pre-meditates a sweep and tickles it to short fine leg
Hazlewood to Behardien, 1 run wicket-to-wicket line, pushed down the ground
Marsh to Behardien, no run full and on off, chopped towards backward point
Marsh to Behardien, 1 run full on off, swings in, FB plays a wafty drive to midwicket

Marsh to Duminy, 2 runs Backward point dives and shells a chance Short and wide outside off, JP lashes a cut in the air. Warner throws himself to his left, attempts the catch with both hands, despite a taped-up thumb, it does not stick. Warner leaves the field. Maxi is on as sub
Marsh to Duminy, no run fuller and angled in around off, JP cuts again. Ends up chopping an inside edge to Wade
Marsh to Duminy, no run short and angled in from wide of the crease, punched to short midwicket
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run veering into the hips, tucked squarer of short fine leg
Hazlewood to Duminy, no run floated full and outside off, Duminy strides forward and drives to the covers
Hazlewood to Duminy, 1 run shorter and just a shade outside off, chopped to third man
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run full and angled in on middle and leg, flicked to short midwicket
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run back of a length and angled in, blocked to short midwicket
Hazlewood to Behardien, 1 run full and aimed at off, pushed for a quick single in front of mid-on. A direct hit from Zampa could have put FB in trouble
Hazlewood to Duminy, 2 runs JP comes down the track and gets a short ball that is lifted over Hazlewood's head
Zampa to Behardien, 1 run drops it short and outside off, swatted to deep midwicket
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run slog swept from outside off to deep midwicket
Zampa to Parnell, no run looped up on middle, he bends forward in defence
Zampa to Parnell, no run legbreak on middle, shorter in length, played back to the bowler
Zampa to Parnell, 1 run pushed down the ground for one
Marsh to Parnell, no run full angled in and straightens a shade outside off, Parnell feels for it and misses
Marsh to Parnell, 1 run awayswinger full and outside off, Parnell throws his hands at it and slices an outside edge to third man
Marsh to Duminy, FOUR runs fraction short and outside off, JP crunches a pull over midwicket. He is now the key for SA
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
Marsh to Parnell, no run overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
Marsh to Parnell, no run short and angled in on middle, blocked
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run Duminy steps out and manufactures a very full ball, which is jabbed to long-on
Zampa to Parnell, 1 run Dropped, burst through the fingers of Faulkner.Wrong'un leaves the left-hander. He slashes an outside edge in the air. Through the hands of Faulkner at backward point
Zampa to Duminy, SIX runs slides on full and outside off, JP goes with the spin and slog sweeps a six into the stands beyond midwicket
Zampa to Abbott, 1 run looks another googly, chopped to sweeper cover
Zampa to Parnell, no run whipped to midwicket as this skids off the surface on middle
Starc to Abbott, no run angled in, yorker, tails away late, past the outside edge
Starc to Phangiso, no run full and angled in from wide of the crease, shapes away late, angled bat defence
Starc to Phangiso, no run another outswinger, draws the tail-ender forward and beats the outside edge
Starc to Phangiso, no run full and outside off, beaten again. This was not far from off stump. Starc knows it and has his hands on his head
Starc to Phangiso, 1 run full and angled in on off, clipped gingerly to mid-on. Phangiso denies Starc a maiden
Zampa to Phangiso, no run short on middle, chopped to short third man
Zampa to Phangiso, 1 run chopped past cover now as this was short again
Zampa to Phangiso, no run drifts in on the leg stump, takes the pad. Looked like it pitched outside leg
Zampa to Phangiso, no run googly, sliding into the leg stump, awkwardly kept out
Zampa to Phangiso, 1 run lobs this up on off, the batsman drags an inside edge through square leg

Starc to Phangiso, OUT Maxi takes a screamer at backward point. Plucks it out of thin air. Angled in full and tails away late outside off at 146ks to mess with the drive. He slices it in the air. Maxi leaps and stretches his right hand over his head. He comes out with the ball in one hand. One-handed stunner! The timing of the jump was impressive
Starc to Tahir, no run Tahir backs away a bit, full on off, kept out
Starc to Tahir, 1 run width outside off, cut to third man
Starc to Rabada, no run full and tails back in late, zips past the inside edge

Starc to Rabada, 1 leg bye big appeal for lbw, not given by Wilson. Steven Smith challenges the on-field call. Inswinging full toss, raps the back pad in front of leg stump. All three stumps visible. Looked like it was sliding down the leg side. The tracker confirms it
Starc to Tahir, 1 run full and angled in, Tahir covers up and secures a single to extra cover
Zampa to Tahir, 1 run flighted on off, the batsman goes low and sweep-scoops to fine leg
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run shorter and outside off, rocks back and pulls to long-on
Zampa to Tahir, no run Wade misses a stumping. Full and dips just outside off as Tahir swings and misses. Wade snatches at the first attempt, juggles, and is late as the batsman slides back
Zampa to Tahir, 1 run chopped to short third man
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run shorter and slapped down the ground
Zampa to Tahir, 1 leg bye dangled up on the leg stump, sweeps and misses, rolls off the pad towards short fine leg
Hazlewood to Tahir, 1 run full and drifting into the pads, glanced to fine leg
Hazlewood to Rabada, 1 leg bye short and shading towards the leg stump, takes the pad and wanders to square leg
Hazlewood to Tahir, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Tahir cuts to sweeper cover

Hazlewood to Rabada, 1 run, OUT Australia win! back of a length and angled in, helped down to deep fine leg. They aim for the second. There is a direct hit at the non-striker's end from wicketkeeper Wade after collecting the throw from Khawaja in the deep. Redemption for the missed stumping? Tahir's bat is in the air as the bails get dislodged. All over
That is all we have for you from this game. Thanks for tuning in. Goodbye and good night/good morning.
Australia, though, had to suffer the anxiety of Warner leaving the field in the chase with a hurt index finger. The latest update is that he will be assessed over the next 24 hours.

8.58pm David Warner set it up with his first ODI century outside Australia, at Warner Park. Amla and the returning du Plessis led SA's chase with fluent half-centuries, before Hazlewood and Zampa triggered a collapse. Starc then burst through the opening and toyed with SA's notoriously long tail. From 210 for 3, they crashed to 252 all out.
Australia won by 36 runs
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
